sens.mc: something that one hopes or intends to accomplish
sens.vi: the purpose of the research is to discover how the virus is transmitted
sens.syn: aim, ambition, aspiration, bourne (also bourn), design, dream, end, idea, ideal, intent, intention, mark, meaning, object, objective, plan, point, pretension, purpose, target, thing
sens.rel: grail, holy grail; plot, project, scheme; desire, hope, mind, wish; nirvana; destination, terminus

sens.mc: the action for which a person or thing is specially fitted or used or for which a thing exists
sens.vi: still trying to discover her purpose in life
sens.syn: business, capacity, function, job, part, place, position, purpose, task, work
sens.rel: affair, concern, hand, involvement, participation; niche, office, post, situation; calling, occupation, pursuit, vocation; activity, assignment, charge, commission, duty, employ, mission, responsibility, service, use

sens.mc: to have in mind as a purpose or goal
sens.vi: I've been purposing to fix that thing for some time now
sens.syn: aim, allow [chiefly Southern & Midland], aspire, calculate, contemplate, design, go [chiefly Southern & Midland], look, mean, meditate, plan, propose, purport, purpose
sens.rel: dream, hope, wish; consider, debate, mull (over), ponder; attempt, endeavor, strive, struggle, try; plot, scheme; accomplish, achieve, effect, execute, perform

sens.mc: not limited or specialized in application or purpose
sens.vi: there's nothing wrong with all-purpose flour for baking bread, but flour with more gluten is better
sens.syn: all-around (also all-round), all-purpose, catholic, general-purpose, unlimited, unqualified, unrestricted, unspecialized
sens.rel: mixed-use, multipurpose; broad, wide; nonspecific, unspecified, vague
sens.near: bounded, circumscribed, confined, definite, demarcated, determinate, finite, qualified; dedicated, selective

sens.mc: not limited or specialized in application or purpose
sens.vi: a general-purpose glue for routine household repairs
sens.syn: all-around (also all-round), all-purpose, catholic, general-purpose, unlimited, unqualified, unrestricted, unspecialized
sens.rel: mixed-use, multipurpose; broad, wide; nonspecific, unspecified, vague
sens.near: bounded, circumscribed, confined, definite, demarcated, determinate, finite, qualified; dedicated, selective
